column4: when i use the alternate installation disk, and put root on a raid, encrypted container, lvm, or combination of these, the system won't boot. is this a known bug, am i doing something wrong, or is it something else?
what does it say at boot-up?
'operating system not found'
hmm, ok. I have never done RAID, sorry.
how about either of the other two?
I recently set up an lvm/dm-crypt system, but didn't use the installer since it would provide less-safe algos only.
algos?
algorithms used by dm-crypt.
2.6.22 can do aes-lrw, but the installer didn't offer it.
aes-lrw is preferred about the default aes-whatever.
That's all I can tell you since I only ran into dm-crypt specific mount problems, nothing like "OS not found".
does grub load?
no, grub doesn't. it seems like the bios can't find the /boot. but it can't be a bios error because the exact same thing happens on completely different machines
you could try re-installing grub.
when I installed, grub installation failed, but I was given a note about this.
there's a good page on grub installation, but it's in German only. If you don't mind, I can give it to you.

i didn't get an indication, but then, i did go off and do other things while it was installing, only coming back at the end. unfortunately, my german is not so hot, and i think that a mediocre grub page would be better than a googletrans of a good page, but i'm willing to take a look anyway
ok, here you go: http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/GRUB
